title: Google\Cloud\PubSub\Subscription
name: Subscription
description: A named resource representing the stream of messages from a single, specific topic, to be delivered to the subscribing application.

examples.caption: Consuming messages received via push with JWT Authentication.

methods.name: __construct
methods.description:
Create a Subscription.

The idiomatic way to use this class is through the PubSubClient or Topic, but you can instantiate it directly as well.

params.name: connection
params.description: The service connection object

params.name: projectId
params.description: The current project

params.name: name
params.description: The subscription name

params.name: topicName
params.description: The topic name the subscription is attached to

params.name: encode
params.description: Whether messages are encrypted or not.

params.name: info
params.description: Subscription info. Used to pre-populate the object.

methods.name: detached
methods.description:
Indicates whether the subscription is detached from its topic.

Detached subscriptions don't receive messages from their topic and don't retain any backlog. Pull and StreamingPull requests will return FAILED_PRECONDITION. If the subscription is a push subscription, pushes to the endpoint will not be made.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: create
methods.description:
Execute a service request creating the subscription.

The suggested way of creating a subscription is by calling through Google\Cloud\PubSub\Topic::subscribe() or Google\Cloud\PubSub\Topic::subscription().

Returns subscription info in the format detailed in the documentation for a subscription.

NOTE: Some methods of instantiation of a Subscription do not supply a topic name. The topic name is required to create a subscription.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

params.name: options.ackDeadlineSeconds
params.description: The maximum time after a subscriber receives a message before the subscriber should acknowledge the message.

params.name: options.deadLetterPolicy
params.description: A policy that specifies the conditions for dead lettering messages in this subscription. If deadLetterPolicy is not set, dead lettering is disabled. The Cloud Pub/Sub service account associated with this subscriptions's parent project (i.e., service-{project_number}@gcp-sa-pubsub.iam.gserviceaccount.com) must have permission to acknowledge messages on this subscription.

params.name: options.deadLetterPolicy.deadLetterTopic
params.description: The topic, or name of the topic to which dead letter messages should be published. Strings must be of format projects/{project}/topics/{topic}. The Cloud Pub/Sub service account associated with the enclosing subscription's parent project (i.e., service-{project_number}@gcp-sa-pubsub.iam.gserviceaccount.com) must have permission to publish to this topic. The operation will fail if the topic does not exist. Users should ensure that there is a subscription attached to this topic since messages published to a topic with no subscriptions are lost.

params.name: options.deadLetterPolicy.maxDeliveryAttempts
params.description: The maximum number of delivery attempts for any message. The value must be between 5 and 100.

params.name: options.enableMessageOrdering
params.description: If true, messages published with the same orderingKey in Google\Cloud\PubSub\Message will be delivered to the subscribers in the order in which they are received by the Pub/Sub system. Otherwise, they may be delivered in any order.

params.name: options.expirationPolicy
params.description: A policy that specifies the conditions for resource expiration (i.e., automatic resource deletion).

params.name: options.expirationPolicy.ttl
params.description: Specifies the "time-to-live" duration for an associated resource. The resource expires if it is not active for a period of ttl. The definition of "activity" depends on the type of the associated resource. The minimum and maximum allowed values for ttl depend on the type of the associated resource, as well. If ttl is not set, the associated resource never expires. If a string is provided, it should be as a duration in seconds with up to nine fractional digits, terminated by 's', e.g "3.5s".

params.name: options.filter
params.description: An expression written in the Pub/Sub filter language. If non-empty, then only messages whose attributes field matches the filter are delivered on this subscription. If empty, then no messages are filtered out. Filtering can only be configured at subscription creation.

params.name: options.messageRetentionDuration
params.description: How long to retain unacknowledged messages in the subscription's backlog, from the moment a message is published. If $retainAckedMessages is true, then this also configures the retention of acknowledged messages, and thus configures how far back in time a Seek can be done. Cannot be more than 7 days or less than 10 minutes. Defaults to 7 days.

params.name: options.pushConfig.attributes
params.description: Endpoint configuration attributes.

params.name: options.pushConfig.oidcToken
params.description: If specified, Pub/Sub will generate and attach an OIDC JWT token as an Authorization header in the HTTP request for every pushed message.

params.name: options.pushConfig.oidcToken.audience
params.description: Audience to be used when generating OIDC token. The audience claim identifies the recipients that the JWT is intended for. The audience value is a single case-sensitive string. Having multiple values (array) for the audience field is not supported. More info about the OIDC JWT token audience here: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7519#section-4.1.3 Note: if not specified, the Push endpoint URL will be used.

params.name: options.pushConfig.oidcToken.serviceAccountEmail
params.description: Service account email to be used for generating the OIDC token. The caller (for subscriptions.create, UpdateSubscription, and subscriptions.modifyPushConfig RPCs) must have the iam.serviceAccounts.actAs permission for the service account.

params.name: options.pushConfig.pushEndpoint
params.description: A URL locating the endpoint to which messages should be pushed. For example, a Webhook endpoint might use "https://example.com/push".

params.name: options.retainAckedMessages
params.description: Indicates whether to retain acknowledged messages.

params.name: options.retryPolicy
params.description: A policy that specifies how Cloud Pub/Sub retries message delivery for this subscription. If not set, the default retry policy is applied. This generally means that messages will be retried as soon as possible for healthy subscribers. Retry Policy will be triggered on NACKs or acknowledgement deadline exceeded events for a given message. Retry Policies are implemented on a best effort basis At times, the delay between deliveries may not match the configuration. That is, the delay can be more or less than the configured backoff.

params.name: options.retryPolicy.minimumBackoff
params.description: The minimum delay between consecutive deliveries of a given message. Value should be between 0 and 600 seconds. Defaults to 10 seconds.

params.name: options.retryPolicy.maximumBackoff
params.description: The maximum delay between consecutive deliveries of a given message. Value should be between 0 and 600 seconds. Defaults to 600 seconds.

params.name: options.enableExactlyOnceDelivery
params.description: Indicates whether to enable 'Exactly Once Delivery' on the subscription.

methods.name: update
methods.description:
Update the subscription.

Note that subscription name and topic are immutable properties and may not be modified.

examples.caption: Updating labels and push config attributes with explicit update masks.

params.name: subscription
params.description: The Subscription data.

params.name: subscription.ackDeadlineSeconds
params.description: The maximum time after a subscriber receives a message before the subscriber should acknowledge the message.

If ttl is not set, the associated resource never expires. If a string is provided, it should be as a duration in seconds with up to nine fractional digits, terminated by 's', e.g "3.5s".

params.name: subscription.pushConfig.attributes
params.description: Endpoint configuration attributes.

params.name: subscription.pushConfig.oidcToken
params.description: If specified, Pub/Sub will generate and attach an OIDC JWT token as an Authorization header in the HTTP request for every pushed message.

params.name: subscription.pushConfig.oidcToken.audience
params.description: Audience to be used when generating OIDC token. The audience claim identifies the recipients that the JWT is intended for. The audience value is a single case-sensitive string. Having multiple values (array) for the audience field is not supported. params.description: Service account email to be used for generating the OIDC token. The caller (for subscriptions.create, UpdateSubscription, and subscriptions.modifyPushConfig RPCs) must have the iam.serviceAccounts.actAs permission for the service account.

params.description: A URL locating the endpoint to which messages should be pushed. For example, a Webhook endpoint might use "https://example.com/push".

params.name: subscription.retainAckedMessages
params.description: Indicates whether to retain acknowledged messages.

params.description: A policy that specifies how Cloud Pub/Sub retries message delivery for this subscription. If not set, the default retry policy is applied. This generally means that messages will be retried as soon as possible for healthy subscribers. Retry Policy will be triggered on NACKs or acknowledgement deadline exceeded events for a given message. Retry Policies are implemented on a best effort basis At times, the delay between deliveries may not match the configuration. That is, the delay can be more or less than the configured backoff.

params.description: The minimum delay between consecutive deliveries of a given message. Value should be between 0 and 600 seconds. Defaults to 10 seconds.

params.name: subscription.retryPolicy.maximumBackoff
params.description: The maximum delay between consecutive deliveries of a given message. Value should be between 0 and 600 seconds. Defaults to 600 seconds.

params.name: subscription.enableExactlyOnceDelivery
params.description: Indicates whether to enable 'Exactly Once Delivery' on the subscription.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.updateMask
params.description: A list of field paths to be modified. Nested key names should be dot-separated, e.g. pushConfig.pushEndpoint. Google Cloud PHP will attempt to infer this value on your behalf, however modification of map fields with arbitrary keys (such as labels or push config attributes) requires an explicit update mask.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options.

methods.name: exists
methods.description:
Check if a subscription exists.

Service errors will NOT bubble up from this method. It will always return a boolean value. If you want to check for errors, use Google\Cloud\PubSub\Subscription::info().

If you need to re-check the existence of a subscription that is already downloaded, call Google\Cloud\PubSub\Subscription::reload() first to refresh the cached information.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

methods.name: info
methods.description:
Get info on a subscription

If the info is already cached on the object, it will return that result. To fetch a fresh result, use Google\Cloud\PubSub\Subscription::reload().

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

methods.name: reload
methods.description:
Retrieve info on a subscription from the API.

To use the previously cached result (if it exists), use Google\Cloud\PubSub\Subscription::info().

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

params.name: options.returnImmediately
params.description: If true, the system will respond immediately, even if no messages are available. Otherwise, wait until new messages are available. Defaults to false.

params.name: options.maxMessages
params.description: Limit the amount of messages pulled. Defaults to 1000.

methods.name: acknowledge
methods.description:
Acknowledge receipt of a message.

Use Google\Cloud\PubSub\Subscription::acknowledgeBatch() to acknowledge multiple messages at once.

params.name: message
params.description: A message object.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

methods.name: acknowledgeBatch
methods.description:
Acknowledge receipt of multiple messages at once.

Use Google\Cloud\PubSub\Subscription::acknowledge() to acknowledge a single message.

params.name: messages
params.description: An array of messages

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

methods.name: modifyAckDeadline
methods.description:
Set the acknowledge deadline for a single ackId.

Use Google\Cloud\PubSub\Subscription::modifyAckDeadlineBatch() to modify the ack deadline for multiple messages at once.

params.name: message
params.description: A message object

params.name: seconds
params.description: The new ack deadline with respect to the time this request was sent to the Pub/Sub system. Must be >= 0. For example, if the value is 10, the new ack deadline will expire 10 seconds after the ModifyAckDeadline call was made. Specifying zero may immediately make the message available for another pull request.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

methods.name: modifyAckDeadlineBatch
methods.description:
Set the acknowledge deadline for multiple ackIds.

Use Google\Cloud\PubSub\Subscription::modifyAckDeadline() to modify the ack deadline for a single message.

params.name: messages
params.description: An array of messages

params.name: seconds
params.description: The new ack deadline with respect to the time this request was sent to the Pub/Sub system. Must be >= 0. For example, if the value is 10, the new ack deadline will expire 10 seconds after the ModifyAckDeadline call was made. Specifying zero may immediately make the message available for another pull request.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

methods.name: modifyPushConfig
methods.description: Set the push config for the subscription

params.name: pushConfig
params.description: Push delivery configuration. See PushConfig for more details.

params.name: pushConfig.pushEndpoint
params.description: A URL locating the endpoint to which messages should be pushed. For example, a Webhook endpoint might use "https://example.com/push".

params.name: pushConfig.attributes
params.description: Endpoint configuration attributes.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

methods.name: seekToTime
methods.description:
Seek to a given timestamp.

When you seek to a time, it has the effect of marking every message received before this time as acknowledged, and all messages received after the time as unacknowledged.

Please note that this method may not yet be available in your project.

params.name: timestamp
params.description: The time to seek to.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: seekToSnapshot
methods.description:
Seek to a given snapshot.

When seeking to a snapshot, any message that had an "unacknowledged" state when the snapshot was created can be re-delivered.

Please note that this method may not yet be available in your project.

params.name: snapshot
params.description: The snapshot to seek to.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: detach
methods.description:
Detach the subscription from its topic.

All messages retained in the subscription are dropped. Subsequent Pull requests will return FAILED_PRECONDITION. If the subscription is a push subscription, pushes to the endpoint will stop.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

methods.name: iam
methods.description: Manage the IAM policy for the current Subscription.
